title: New Stadium: 2020 MEC
excerpt: Monster Energy Cup moves to California.
author: Lewis Phillips
content:
Subscribe to MX Vice on YouTube.

Follow @MXVice on Instagram.

Dave Prater, the Director of Operations at Monster Energy Supercross, confirmed today that the 2020 Monster Energy Cup will take place in Southern California, rather than at Sam Boyd Stadium in Las Vegas. The move comes as no surprise – Sam Boyd Stadium will be demolished later this year. The announcement was made via the following statement in the pre-season press conference at Angel Stadium today.

"The Monster Energy Cup will be moving to Southern California on October 10 2020. The event will take place at Dignity Health Sports Park, just right down the road in Carson. Those tickets go on sale tomorrow morning at 10:00 pacific time. We are extremely excited about that. It is a new era for the Monster Energy Cup."

The penultimate round of 2020 Monster Energy Supercross is actually scheduled to be the final event that is held within Sam Boyd Stadium. It is the end of an era!

Words: Lewis Phillips | Lead Image: Race Kawasaki
